title: Computer-Mediated Interactive Simulation for Scientific Argumentation-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary education-level foundational knowledge in mathematics and science, along with basic understanding of argumentative reasoning
context.additional_context: Learners are Professionals (Medical/Legal/Technical) Aiming to Explore Complex Scientific Concepts Argumentatively and Enhance Critical Thinking. They Refine Argumentation Skills by Interacting with Computer Agents in VR Environments

learning_goals: Learners can improve their conceptual understanding of scientific concepts (e.g., diffusion) by 20% through argumentative dialogue.
Learners can apply a 'deliberative' argumentation style in computer-mediated interactions with 80% accuracy.
Learners can achieve 75% proficiency in identifying and correcting scientific errors through argumentation activities with peers and computer agents.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
